info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 10:42PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms in northeastern Wayne County through 1145 PM EDT... At 1040 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Downtown Detroit, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will affect the following locations... Highland Park, Melvindale, Redford, Northeast Detroit, Northwest Detroit, Harper Woods, Ecorse, Southwest Detroit, Allen Park and Dearborn Heights. People attending Comerica Park, and the Aretha Franklin Amphitheater should seek safe shelter immediately! MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
